description: Sensitivity analysis showing how UK Biobank (UKB) dominance affects overall statistics

summary.recommendation: Results remain valid but should be interpreted acknowledging UKB's outsized influence

notes: No biobank achieves 'High' EAS category without UK Biobank
Second-highest EAS (55.1) is 29.4 points below UK Biobank (84.6)
The gap between UK Biobank and #2 exceeds the entire range of other biobanks

publication_concentration.interpretation: Publication output is highly concentrated - top 5 biobanks produce 65% of all publications, with UK Biobank alone contributing over a third

eas_distribution_analysis.interpretation: Excluding UKB minimally affects the distribution below the 95th percentile, confirming UKB is an exceptional outlier rather than distorting the overall picture

europe_without_ukb.notes: Removing UKB reduces European publications by nearly two-thirds

interpretation_guidance: UK Biobank's exceptional performance reflects its design, funding, and infrastructure - it sets a benchmark rather than distorting analysis
The 'High' EAS category effectively represents UK Biobank-level achievement, which may be unrealistic for newer or lower-resourced biobanks
For policy purposes, comparing biobanks to the 'Moderate' threshold (40-69) may be more actionable than to UK Biobank
The analysis reveals that even well-established biobanks (NHS, WHI) have substantial equity gaps to address

methodology.calculations: Statistics computed by including/excluding UK Biobank from the 70-biobank IHCC dataset
